    There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. C.A.R. Hoare, 1980 ACM Turing Award Lecture

    The art of getting things done also involves the art of leaving things undone Stop buying the unnecessary, stop doing the non-essential. You are what you do. Not what you say, not what you believe, not how you vote, but what you spend your time on. People are fed by the food industry, which pays no attention to health, and are treated by the health industry, which pays no attention to food.
